Header: Vijith Vijayamuni Soysa pays obeisance at the Sri Dalada Maligawa and receives blessings
Content: Vijith Vijayamuni Soysa who took oaths as Minister of Fisheries, Aquatic Resource Development and Rural Economy paid obeisance at the Sri Dalada Maligawa and received blessings. The Minister after assuming office visited the Sri Dalada Maligawa and engaged in religious observances. Thereafter the Minister expressed views to the media. Minister Vijith Vijayamuni Soysa said the President can give time to secure a majority and entrusted the premiership to a trustworthy person. It was in this manner that the Premiership was handed over to Ranil Wickremasinghe who had 42 members while they were having a two thirds majority. He said they should be talented to respond to foreign powers. Maithripala Sirisena, the President and Mahinda Rajapaksa, the Prime Minister are two such talented persons. In the meantime, Minister of Tourism and Wildlife Wasantha Senanayake and Deputy Minister Ananda Aluthgamage arrived at the Agiriya Maha Vihare and paid a courtesy call on the Asgiriya Mahanayake Thera the Most Ven. Warakagoda Gnanarathana Thera and received his blessings.
